testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: -Configure AP Enable 2 dhcp server（mgt0.1 mgt0.2） Mgt0.1 vlan10 IPaddr 10.1.10.1 gateway 10.1.10.1 Mgt0.2 vlan20 IPaddr 10.1.20.1 gateway 10.1.20.1 Laptop1 connect to Mgt0.1 IPaddr 10.1.10.2 Laptop2 connect to Mgt0.2 IPaddr 10.1.20.2 Laptop3 connect to Mgt0.1 IPaddr 10.1.10.3
Test Procedure: 1) Laptop1 and Laptop3 ping Laptop2 100 packets 2) Show logging and look up the network firewall logs "show logging buffered | include l3-fw" 3) Configure network firewall rule "network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to network 10.1.20.2 255.255.255.255 action permit logging on" "network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging off" 4) Laptop1 and Laptop3 ping Laptop2 100 packets 5) Show logging and look up the network firewall logs "show logging buffered | include l3-fw" 6) Delete network firewall config "no network-firewall" 7) Configure network firewall rule "network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to network 10.1.20.2 255.255.255.255 action deny logging on" "network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging off" 8) Laptop1 and Laptop3 ping Laptop2 100 packets 9) Show logging and look up the network firewall logs "show logging buffered | include l3-fw" 10) Delete network firewall config on AP1 "no network-firewall" 11) Laptop1 and Laptop3 ping Laptop2 100 packets 12) Show logging and look up the network firewall logs "show logging buffered | include l3-fw"

step.desc: config CVG act as l3 VPN server
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ee-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_cert.pem" -v "save vpn private-key tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_key.pem" -v "vpn xauth-client-list ${hive.name}_List local" -v "vpn xauth-client-list ${hive.name}_List client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn server-ipsec-tunnel ${hive.name}_Server vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${hive.name}_Server client-list ${hive.name}_List" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy server ipsec-tunnel ${hive.name}_Server" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}"

step.desc: enable ospf on CVG eth1
step.telnet: -v "routing protocol ospf advertise eth1" -v "routing protocol ospf router-id ${cvg1.cvg.lan.ip}" -v "routing protocol type ospf" -v "routing protocol enable"

step.desc: config BR with WAN interface, nat enable
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp client" -v "no interface mgt0 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${cvg1.cvg.wan.netmask}"

step.desc: Show interface eth0 dhcp client to check if DNS server be obtained
config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable,dns service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0.1 dns-server int-domain-name ${cvg1.dns1.domain1}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dns-server int-resolve dns1 ${cvg1.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dns-server ext-resolve dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dns-server enable"

step.desc: Set interface eth0 to wan mode,eth1 to access mode and enable mac-learning
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mac-learning enable"

step.desc: config BR as l3 VPN client
step.console: -v "save vpn ca-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/cacert.pem" -v "vpn client-ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_client_ipsec_1 vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_client_ipsec_1 gateway ${cvg1.cvg.mip.ip} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy client ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_client_ipsec_1 primary" -v "routing route-request enable" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${cvg1.cvg.wan.netmask}"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
check vpn ike sa on BR1 side
check vpn ike sa on CVG side
check gre tunnel on br1 side
check gre tunnel on cvg side
BR check route
cvg1 check route
_ff id 1 src-ip ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional _kdebug fe basic _kdebug fe detail clear log all
step.telnet: -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "clear log all"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 ping cvg1.vpc1
Show logging and look up the network firewall logs
clear log all
Laptop2 ping Laptop1
Show logging and look up the network firewall logs

Configure network firewall rule “network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to vpn action permit logging on” "network-firewall name 1002 from vpn to network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 action permit logging on" “network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging off”
step.telnet: -v "clear log all" -v "network-firewall name 1001 from network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_1} to vpn action permit logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1002 from vpn to network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_1} action permit logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1003 from any to any action deny logging off"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 ping cvg1.vpc1
check log
step.log-match: -p "(?i)ACCEPT PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1001\)" -c 1 -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: clear log all
Laptop2 ping Laptop1
Show logging and look up the network firewall logs
step.log-match: -p "(?i)ACCEPT PACKET: SRC=${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1002\)" -c 1 -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: Delete network firewall config "no network-firewall"

Configure network firewall rule “network-firewall name 1001 from network 10.1.10.2 255.255.255.255 to network 10.1.20.2 255.255.255.255 action deny logging on” “network-firewall name 1002 from any to any action deny logging off”
step.telnet: -v "clear log all" -v "network-firewall name 1001 from network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_1} to vpn action deny logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1002 from vpn to network ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} ${br1.vpc1.mac_1} action deny logging on" -v "network-firewall name 1003 from any to any action deny logging off"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 ping cvg1.vpc1
check log
step.log-match: -p "DROP PACKET: SRC=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1001\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: clear log all
Laptop2 ping Laptop1
Show logging and look up the network firewall logs
step.log-match: -p "DROP PACKET: SRC=${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} DST=${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} PROTO=ICMP TYPE=8 CODE=0 \(RULE=1002\)" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: Delete network firewall config "no network-firewall"
br1.vpc1 ping cvg1.vpc1
Show logging and look up the network firewall logs
clear log all
Laptop2 ping Laptop1
Show logging and look up the network firewall logs
